SENT.plain: We describe a unique case of achondroplasia with associated complications, including severe respiratory problems
Molecular analysis of the fibroblast growth factor receptor type 3 (FGFR3) gene in this patient showed the common p.G380R mutation and a second novel p.L377R mutation
An allele-specific PCR demonstrated that these mutations were on the same allele (cis)
Both mutations were not present in the parents and appear to have occurred de novo
To our knowledge, this is the first report in the literature on an achondroplasia patient with two FGFR3 mutations on the same allele
